Posts.Content: GRB wrote: and wow...it hurts. He placed a drain in, as well. I was pretty groggy. It was under general anesthesia, as well. Why a drain? I go back this pm for him to remove it. He told us that 'nothing jumped out at him', but it needs to be sent out for pathology. Can a Dr. "see" bad stuff in the area just by looking? I have unusual inflammation he said. It was a tough day yesterday. I brought them a sore, scaly, inflammed nipple. I knew this would be sore. I hope it's less sore when the drain comes out? Does that hurt? Thanks ahead of time. Posts.Title: had a nipple biopsy yesterday GRB GRB

Posts.Content: May 24, 2009 03:22PM GRB wrote: Coming from someone who just had her nipple and areola cut in to last Monday, I would still do the biopsy again. Almost a week later, my right boob is purple, swollen, and sore. Sportsbras are my new best friend, and man, oh man- if you walk too close to me at Walmart, I may pound that person. But, I have piece of mind. I have never, ever had a biopsy before until last Monday.  I don't have Paget's. I have some issue in my sinuses in the nipple, but now I know......and I am happy I know. Good luck. G
Posts.Title: Pagets symptoms?? cshamber sadsel

Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 12:58PM GRB wrote: I have to say...I live in a small state, and went to a little town to a Dr. and he said that the biopsy would be the only way to tell. I was indeed surprised when he said they had to put me to sleep for this. I thought he could just numb me and do it....  My nipple is sunken standing up, laying down....my left nipple is just a sad, shy nipple...the scaliness really is so different, - that I have to know what it is... I will let everyone know what I find out. It's just odd. Thanks. G
Posts.Title: Pagets symptoms?? cshamber sadsel

Posts.Content: May 26, 2009 02:51PM GRB wrote: Hi Cshamber- I go this Fri for full report. Something with lactiferous sinuses in nipple- they are inflamed and have been for some time...it was pretty icky when i went in.i had no issues at all with areola- but my nipple was so icky, scaly...it was AWFUL on the day of surgery last week. it was throbbing. I hope i have no more surgery in this area....  it was inverted, but when he biopsied it- he pulled the nipple out- so now its an outie- its all stitched up as well as about half my areola. it still hurts - and is extremely sensitive and achey...i live in new england, and it was windy yesterday- and man- i felt the sensitivity....    I never breast fed, and my boys are almost 13 and 10, so not sure why my milk duct sinuses went freaky on me....i would love to know. i will share report when i get it. G
Posts.Title: Pagets symptoms?? cshamber sadsel

Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 07:32AM GRB wrote: I am going Monday for a nipple biopsy. I have a scaly, inverted nipple. The scaliness comes and goes, and this is only on my nipple. I had a mammo that showed the inverted nipple, but no abnormalities. I went right to a surgeon to decide if per the report, which I received a Bi-rads 0, what I was supposed to do, as the report basically said to biopsy, ultrasound or MRI the area. The surgeon said to biopsy it. In my case, when you pull the nipple to EVERT out- it's bigger and looks quite different from the other nipple. This Dr. said it could be minor reasons it is like that to major reasons it is like that. He said that my nipple is a little scaly(which comes and goes), and 'inflamed'....The scaliness can have it's bad days- again- this is JUST on my nipple. So, I have gone back and forth whether to do this biopsy, but have decided, I will do it. I need to know what is going on with it.  They are going to put me to sleep for it on Monday am. So, I am 37, no family history on mom's side...HOWEVER- my mom- herself, JUST found a lump last week... Thanks. Gail
Posts.Title: Pagets symptoms?? cshamber sadsel

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 01:44PM GRB wrote: I had a scaly nipple. It was just my nipple. It was wierd- that is all I can say. This was unilateral, and was very sore. I hope it's nothing,- I am hoping it doesn't happen anymore- that is all I can say. It was 'messed up'. I am 37 yrs old. I did go to work for a few hours today though, I had the surgery on Monday.   Good luck. G

Posts.Content: May 9, 2009 07:39AM GRB wrote: I am assuming per the report this surgeon will send me for an ultrasound, mri, and/or biopsy. My right nipple when you try to evert it- is much wider, and flatter than my regular happy nipple. I guess I want to know why the nipple looks so different than the right nipple. It goes right back in. The scaliness will come and go, but on and off thru out the last yr, I have had it. I have no scaliness on the left nipple at all. I cannot feel any mass in either breast. It is very clear to me there is a difference with this right nipple, and I just wonder why the nipple has such a different look to it. I go on Monday at 11am. Thanks. G
Posts.Title: Nipple questions! GRB GRB

Posts.Content: May 23, 2009 07:23PM GRB wrote: Yes, I am realizing this isn't a quick heal. This is going to be weeks, I think..... I have lots of sportsbras, and lots of Advil.  I do have the harder medicine, but save it for night. My heart goes out to the women dealing with breast cancer. As achey/bruised/swollen as my breast is, I know this was a biopsy that came back benign, but really think about all the women with breast cancer and my heart goes out to all of these women. Whatever is going on in my lactiferous sinuses that became inflammed/infected, I know they can fix it. I am satisfied with the Drs. care, and that he wanted to investigate it.....   Thanks. G
Posts.Title: Nipple/areola biopsy- spoke to Dr. GRB Polyana

Posts.Content: May 21, 2009 07:05PM GRB wrote: I don't have my report but the office called. I have some issue in the lactiferous sinus?- in the nipple...either infection or inflammation. Whatever it was was painful.I have a 12 yr old and 10 yr so I wasn't breastfeeding! but I do NOT cancer. I will find out more next week. The lady at the office knew I wanted to know as soon as they knew. They do quite a bit of cutting for a nipple/areola biopsy, so I am just taking it easy wearing my gauze and sportsbra. He did 'correct' the inverted nipple, as it was stuck in there pretty tight. I wonder if that has something to do with the inflammation/scaliness of the nipple, when you take it out and it isn't an 'innie' anymore?
Posts.Title: Nipple/areola biopsy- spoke to Dr. GRB Polyana

Posts.Content: GRB wrote: Hello. I had some questions. I admire all of you for what you go thru, and hope - as going thru what you go thru, you could answer some of my questions. I have an inverted nipple. It has been like this for some time. Hubby says not forever though, and - well- I believe him. My inverted right nipple is INVERTED. You can get it to come out, however- it just puckers right back in. There is a different 'look' about it. It looks quite different from my happy left nipple, as I call it. It has some dry skin on the nipple ONLY. No dry skin on areola- it's just on nipple. Also, it appears to me as it's either a cyst(as it's quite mishapen) for a montgomery gland- right on the edge of where my nipple seems to invert. This 'cyst'(as I think it probably is) appears to be getting larger- however- it's a little scaly, but not painful. This particular area is where I think I really feel there is a different "look."  I am 37, no history of breast cancer on mom's side of family. My father's mother had bc, and had a masectomy, however she died yrs ago of heart failure not related to the bc. I have had a diagnosic mammo 2 weeks ago, which noted my very inverted nipple, but no masses or calcifications.  The radiologist was honest with me that sometimes we don't see things in mammo's. I go on Monday to a surgeon, as I got a BI-RAD score of 0, and further assessment is needed. My GP wants to send me for ultrasound. The report left it open for a biopsy, ultrasound, or breast MRI. I frankly have never had a biopsy on anything, but would probably opt for that if that could tell us something that we may not see with an ultrasound. Living in a rural area, I have to go North a bit to a surgeon whose office is right next to hospital, so I am hopeful he can give me some direction with this. And, in addition....- when they recommend an ultrasound in addition to the mammo- will they ultrasound both breasts or just the questionable one? Thanks ahead of time. G Log in to post a reply
